name: New Runner Deck
Ian Sterling LateRush
Parkour!
description:
Building off of GreatGreedyGuts's "Running the Rincewind Way" and CrimsonWraith's "The Magical Equivalent of Zero", I decided to take the Desperado/Security Testing Whizzard build for a spin myself. Honestly, I've just been trying to get Keyhole into one of my decks since I lost to it hard at a store tournament. This deck seemed like it might be a fun fit for it. Hopefully I'm not destroying a work of art by poking holes in it...

As for the name of the list, I'm not quite so familiar with Discworld, but I'm hugely into the Dresden Files. In the most recent book, Harry has taken up Parkour as a hobby. As such every time he jumps he shouts "Parkour!" at the top of his lungs. I might do the same every time I pass a piece of ICE. Or not. We'll see.

name: Reflektor Kate
description:
I thought I found a way to enter Ice's just a deflektor (It's just a Deflektor) I thought I'd found the decoder Ice's just a deflektor (It's just a Deflektor)

Now these credits we spend, are spent again We're still connected, but are we still running? I ran the net when I was nineteen And now I'm stuck in a screen

I thought I found a way to enter Ice's just a Deflektor(It's just a Deflektor) I thought I'd found the decoder Ice's just a Deflektor(It's just a Deflektor)

name: AND one!
description:
Well, I'm going a tiny bit out of my own personal comfort zone here with this one, but it's worth a shot. As I get more and more acquainted with Shaper (Professor in particular), I'm really beginning to appreciate how they work.

I absolutely love PeekaySK's "Vivat Academia" incarnation, but when I tried it out, something seemed to be missing. When Spaces between released, I took one look at the recyclable gem known as D4v1d, and instantly thought of this Professor build.

It's got genuine versatility that goes above and beyond what any other runner identity can hope to accomplish. You can be tricky; you can be precise; you can be a powerhouse...it all depends on what you're going up against at the time.

Just about half the cards in the deck are FHF (first hand friendly), so even if your start is a little on the slow side, you know that you'll eventually draw into an effective battle plan.

As always, feedback encouraged. :)

name: Stirling Late
Chaos Oracle v1
description: Inspired by DJhedgehog

name: M.P.D.G
description:
I have questions!

Test Run -> Scavenge will work to get a Femme Fatale for free right?

Can I host an icebreaker on a Dinosaurus and then also host as many Personal Touches as I can find on top of that icebreaker?

Feedback always welcome.

name: Kate YogoSaurus Replicatus daggering in the morning star
description:
Dinosaur the Yog ptouch the dagger (for archer etc) and maybe the morning star twice if needed. Support by the sucker. The aim is cheap breaking. Replicator for speeding up the silencer and ptouch. Comments and hints are welcome!

Updated my previous published deck: Due to lack of eco I changed the ID to Kate for cheaper install and added 3 ProfCons. Additional 1 Netshield and 1 R+D-Interface to fill up to 45. Changed the Akamatsu to Cybersolution, Changed 1 Scavenge and 1 Cloak for the 2nd and 3rd R+D Interface. Perhaps replacing the Sucker with a femme to get bypass-option. Still testing out.

name: And Then
description: Heavily defend servers, gives away the information but can make it very expensive to run very quickly

name: I'd hardly call myself a Master Gamer
My Red Coats
Glacier National Park
Reina Rush
description: This is an updated version of the deck I learned to play netrunner playing. Attack hard and fast, switching between centrals and surprising remotes with Knight and D4V1D. Keeping the corp is key.

name: Noise: Devastator v1.5
description: This is the newest iteration of my Noise-Deck and it works really really well. For more insights on card choices an playstyle have a look at my original decklist :)

name: Trapteki
description: Basic Jinteki: Personal Evolution trap deck running mostly traps almost no ice.

name: Aggressive Whizzard
description: One thing I've noticed while playing my Whizzard decks is that his ability awards multiple runs on a shoestring budget since he can trash whatever assets the corp has. Thanks to inspiration from the Rincewind deck I decided to try out Desperado and threw out a Deep Red/Overmind package I had been trying to use. Run early, run often, trash everything, and don't get Scorched.

name: Motivating Kate
Accelerated Shutdowns FA
description:
Deck Plan

  • This is at heart a breaker kill deck. With 3x Archived Memories, 3x Power Shutdown, grims and rotos, kill those faeries, datasuckers, SMCs, corroders. Recur the Power Shutdowns at your leisure and punch it. You have Archive Memories and Jackson Howard to save those agendas from archive.

  • Most ICE are hard ETR due to the breaker kill aspect. As such, this is played like Supermodernism. Install 2 different subtype of ICE in remote and if runner rig permits, start scoring.

  • The first thing to score is Efficiency Committee. This opens up the Power Shutdown + Accelerated Diagnostics combo wide open. (I wouldn't explain the combo here, BGG has a lot of articles about it) I have two interns for the rare case of being able to score 5 points with the combo and to combat parasite and jackson trashing.

  • This has Fast Advance options in the form of Efficiency Committee counters, Shipment from Sansan and the lone biotic labor. Do not hold back on using Shipment from Sansan if needed. It is an econ card, and with 3x archived memories, you'll get them back. Oh, and you want them in the archives anyway. ;)

name: And Then v0.1
description: Experiment on an idea. Credit to delphicokami

name: Dec@Day.04 - By Hook or By Crook
description:
Dec@Day - Every identity, one day and deck at a time. It's like NaNoWriMo for Netrunner! More info in my profile.

Oh, Gabe...like most decks using our professional here, the goal is to hit hard in the early game and (hopefully) never let the Corp recover. Knight and Faerie takes the sting out of those early-game Sentries, and Deus X even lets us face-check Jinteki without too much worry. A Grappling Hook and Overmind also give Gabe breathing room against the more formidiable ice, especially with e3 Feedback Implants in play.

Run early, run often. Land as many Account Siphons as you can, and force the Corp to double or triple ICE its remotes with the threat of Inside Job. Emergency Shutdown the scary ICE once you've Grappling Hooked through it, and use Clone Chip and Special Order to make sure you always have the right Icebreaker handy.

This is definitely one of the more...interesting...decks I've played, and while it's not the most consistent beast, it certainly is fun to live life on the edge. I'm sure that's exactly what Gabe would want anyway. :)

Suggestions, critiques or comments? Feel free--the entire reason I'm doing this is to build my deckbuilding skills. Special thanks to umbalAeronaut for his incredibly insightful comment on yesterday's Jinteki deck, and stop by tomorrow for my attempt to build a non-Fast-Advance NBN deck.

Previous Dec@Day Decks:

  • 01 HB: EtF - Fix It in Beta
  • 02 An: Noise - Trojan Whale
  • 03 Ji: PE - Sword of Damocles

name: Pay Now, Dont Pay Later 2.5
description:
Event heavy Iain Stirling deck. The Idea been while your setting up your rig you get free credits from the corp scores, Then you pile the pressure on with events when set up with runs all over the place.

The Prepaid VoicePAD helps the econ immensely.

New Angeles lets you avoid tags all day long and completely ignore them data-ravens, the 2 fall guys help keep them up and running.

data-dealer is a shi kyu counter plus can be used to drop you back a few points if need be.

Torch, Garrote & Corroded for excellent efficiency once you get them out theirs no stopping you.

Desperado helps keep the econ going when your running.

Changes:-

Took out the plasecrete carapace it had no real value in the deck with the new angeles they carnt tag you anyway added John Masanori for some extra draw.

Changed snitch for another hostage as the snitch was of no value to me once the rigs setup nothing can stop you given the funds.

Changes from 2.0

Took out the levy and quality time wasn't making much use out of them swap them for 2 retrievals and added a faerie for the spare MU, hopefully the retrievals will work as a way to get a trashed program back or a cheap way to get a torch or garrote out.

name: Jackson and Caprice in Protocol Valley
description: Overdued my last deck, concentrating on taxing clicks.

name: Good Old Tag'N'Bag
description: Another Spaces Between update

name: Wormholes to hell
Too Good to be Yours
description: NBN: Making News is a Megacorporation based on the SanSan City Grid dedicated to server security and profitability. By running open servers behind Pop-up Window, Caduceus, and RSVP coupled with sever upgrades such as Red Herrings and Caprice Nisei NBN can allow public access without compromising data security. NBN focuses on market research in order to deliver the best possible service to its customers. To accomplish this user data collected by ICE such as Caduceus, Hunter, and Data Raven as well as projects like TGTBT are compiled into Market Research for the discerning business.

name: Running with Corrosive Knives
description:
Your goal is to get DinoBlade with Magnum Opus funding everything by the end of turn 3.

Your starting hand MUST have a code gate breaker + Magnum Opus OR one of those & Self-modifying Code to tutor for what is missing. If you have to mulligan & still don’t get what you need, it isn’t the end of the world – just start tearing through your Stack with Diesel & Quality Time until you find everything.

You NEED to get MO on the table first. Once that is settled, the rest will follow much easier.

Cyber-Cypher is there in as an early game breaker until you get DinoBlade working. Cyber-Cypher is the code gate breaker I will tutor for with Self-Modifying Code, if I didn’t start with Blade in my opening hand.

Multiple Ghost Runners will easily fund Dagger and the creds are available for all your breakers.

You will usually need Leprechaun on the table to get all your stuff out. I don’t bother to put MO on it because I want that on the table ASAP. You’ll use it for SMC. {Unless you get a game of perfect draws! = DinoBlade, Magnum Opus (2MU), Corroder (1MU), Dagger (1MU).}

I chose to spend my influence on Corroder and Lucky Find. Corroder is the best barrier breaker available, IMO. Lucky Find may seem odd, but I’ve had a lot of games where they’ve allowed me to get my DinoBlade + MO rig and on the table & Running the end of turn 2.

The deck is short on cards that punish the Corp. I wanted to put in Vamp, but it was mostly a utility card and didn’t always hit the table. (When it did though, it was a game winner.) Hopefully, the Rig is cruel / fast enough to plow through everything the Corp puts in front of you on its own.

Kit will Tinker to force a couple layers of ICE to be code gates. You can then play Maker’s Eye to run with DinoBlade that stays as strong as needed the whole run - accessing 3 cards from R&D.

Net Celebrity is there to play in defense of other currents, but it never hurts to have a recurring credit.

name: Head in the Clouds
description:
This is my attempt at a solid Keyhole build. I have tried to run it out of Anarch for a bit, but I realized that for Keyhole to work you need to be able to get into R&D consistently and efficiently. So you need to get the rig pieces you need out fast and have enough money to keep running. I went the Shaper route over crim because I like test run+scavenge for Fem and also only having to run 1 copy of Keyhole.

For econ, the build this is based off of used Magnum opus, and ran ZU.13 and Creeper as breakers to save memory. I didn't like that, so I chose resource economy because PPvP would need Lucky Find, which is a bit of influence. For MU boosting I run 3 akamatsu, as well as 1 spinal modem as another MU source as well as recurring creds to help out with money.

Basic idea is to start getting out the rig first, a lot of people won't see Keyhole coming and you don't want to bring it out to early. Face check early R&D ice, but keep pressure on HQ and remotes so all the ice doesn't pile on R&D. You don't want to wait too long to bring out Keyhole, or it will be too expensive to get in R&D, or FA will do its job and win before you can catch up. Legwork is there for when keyhole runs aren't seeing the agendas and you know they are building in HQ. Hades Shard is there to get around Jackson.

This is my first published deck, so any advice is welcome. I have been a big fan of Keyhole for awhile, and I really wanna make it work.

name: Blue Sun Mushin
description:
Use Blue Sun to bounce your Off the Grids back to hand until you need them to protect a Mushin target. Over-advance Project Atlas to get more Mushins. Bounce Adonis to reset them, otherwise bounce a large Oversighted or Requisitioned ice, worthless Hives, or Ice easily reinstalled/rezzed with the Root's reoccurring credits. Probably run Crisium Grids in the future on HQ to further protect the Grids.

Little unsure about the ice spread.
